about_the_game:
In this thrilling game, players will engage in intense base building and destruction battles as they compete against each other, with the added excitement of unpredictable power-ups. Whether facing off against a friend or an enemy, players can choose to engage in one-on-one combat on the same device or take on the challenge of a computer AI opponent.

As players build and defend their bases, the ultimate goal is to dominate the battlefield by claiming more bases than their opponent. A dynamic meter tracks the progress of each player, with the ownership of bases determining the rate at which the meter moves in their favor. The player with the most bases will see their meter move at a faster pace, bringing them closer to victory. Will you rise to the challenge and claim ultimate dominance?

What is the game about?

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS or newer
  • Processor: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.2+ or Vulkan-capable, Nvidia and AMD GPUs.
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS or newer
  • Processor: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.2+ or Vulkan-capable, Nvidia and AMD GPUs.
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mojave
  • Processor: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Integrated graphic card with 1.5 GB VRAM
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Catalina
  • Processor: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated graphic card with 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: IMPORTANT: In MacOS Catalina Apple introduced new security measures and you'll get the message "Base Jump would like to receive keystrokes from any application" simply deny the request and the game will still work, we don't collect anything in any way, the message pop up due to how Unity listens for keystrokes to make the game work.
